p: Such “unexpected” experiments have been instructive in the past for analyzing surface temperatures. Travis et al. (2004) used the three‐day grounding of aircraft activity after the 9/11 attacks to investigate the impact of contrails on regional surface temperatures. Liu et al. (2022) used the COVID‐19 lockdown to explore surface temperatures from a different perspective. Employing over 3,700 ground air temperature measurements and NASA satellite data, they revealed declines in the magnitude of urban heat islands(UHIs) across many Chinese cities.
